newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Hong Kong gold ends down on stronger dollar/yen.
newsitem.headline: Hong Kong gold ends down on stronger dollar/yen.

text.p: Hong Kong spot gold ended down on Thursday from New York's previous close following dealer sales on the back of a stronger dollar, bullion traders said.
Gold ended at US$342.10/342.60 an ounce on Thursday, down from New York's US$343.60/344.10 close on Wednesday.
Dealers said strong selling on the back of a firmer dollar pushed gold down.
"Everybody was just selling," said one dealer.
Traders said the gold was likely to head further south, but slowly. Some dealers also reported gold sales on a lower Australian dollar.
The U.S. dollar surged to 115.80 yen by early afternoon, a steep 4.5 yen jump from Wednesday's New York close.
The dollar skyrocketed on Thursday after Eisuke Sakakibara, head of the Japanese Ministry of Finance's International Bureau, said the country's trade surplus was not a cause for concern.
Physical demand was average, but some dealers reported healthy buying interest when gold dipped below $342 per ounce.
Hong Kong tael gold ended HK$11 down at HK$3,165 per tael.
The carry over charge at the Chinese Gold and Silver Exchange Society dropped to -5.50 from its previous fix at nil.
